text: <@U26B530N6>, i was able to get it to work <https://www.fasterbetter.dev/blog/HubSpot-webpack/getting-started|from here>. Thanks

<@U7SL518D6> detecting hubl dynamically could be done via regex on `.html` files.
This regex `/^(<!--\n)((\s|\n)+(templateType|label):(\s)+.{1,37})+/g` detects
```<!--
  templateType: name_up_to_37_characters
  label: name_up_to_37_characters```
I chose 37 characters bc the longest `templateType` option is currently 37 characters (`email_subscriptions_confirmation_page`)
This is great! Thank you so much!
One more thing: I built a CLI that generates a new boilerplate project with the full set up from all of those posts: <https://www.fasterbetter.dev/blog/create-HubSpot-project>
If anyone has time to try it out and make sure nothing crazy happens I would definitely appreciate it!
Also, I might build a site to generate a build command from selected options...so let me know what options you would like to see
I’m going to go through the setup for this and make sure it’s up to date. Sorry for all the confusion

Thanks, will do. I just want to get one person to try it so that I know the instructions are clear enough. I never realized it would be so easy to publish an NPM package.
